title: Executive Order 5908-Public Water Restoration No. 12, California
content: So much of the order of withdrawal dated May 17, 1927, creating Order of Withdrawal for Municipal Water-Supply Purposes, as affects the lands hereinafter listed is hereby revoked:
sec. 26, lots 1, 2, E. ½ SE. ¼;
sec. 11, lots 1, 2, 3, 4, E. ½ SW. ¼;
sec. 23, lots 1, 2, 3, 4, E. ½ NW. ¼, SW. ¼ SE. ¼;
sec. 26, lots 1, 2, 3, 4, W. ½ E. ½;
T. 5 S., R. 23 E., sec. 1, lots 1, 5, SE. ¼ NW. ¼, E. ½ SW. ¼;
sec. 12, lot 1, W. ½ NE. ¼, NE. ¼ SE. ¼.

All public lands in the following-described sections which lie within 50 feet of the proposed location of a conduit to carry water from Colorado River as shown on a map (Exhibit J) accompanying the application of the City of Los Angeles for a right of way filed in the General Land Office under Los Angeles 043640:
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5908-Public Water Restoration No. 12, California Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/361721
